top_comments.comment: Dude has been farming this for 30 years and he's not rich yet, that's a problem.
We in kerala dont consider cardamom as expensive, As we buy it less than quarter of a kilo

It is NOT climate crisis.  Stop the BS.  Stop buying Fertilizer !!! Compost, Worm Compost.  Climate Crisis is the new term to scare farmers into becoming a collective owned by the rich.   Western World, change climate by not buying Stuff made in Chinese Coal Fired, or Factories that are powered by a destroyed Yankee River hydro plant.  Stop supporting Chinese Slave Labor Camps by buying unnecessary 4th pairs of sneakers, etc.etc.

comments_since_last_sample.body: Price rise of cardamom doesn't always mean rise of income of farmers. My father is a cardamom farmer for 20 plus years. As far as i can remember good harvest and good price coincided only 4 or 5 times. It's really hard to make a living for small scale cardamom farmers.
U will nEVER put out a video talking about ANYTHING being overpriced 🤔🤔wonder y😏

I had two small plants on my farm in Texas this year and something destroyed both of them.  I use it in my tea every day.  When I travel to Kerala and back, airport security makes me throw away all my seeds.
Say it three times, then it's free
We in kerala dont consider cardamom as expensive, As we buy it less than quarter of a kilo
There was a time that I taught cinnamon is cardamom ✌️
Its only costs 12$/ kg when you visit farmers in kerala.
